hero.title: Net Zero Racing
hero.subtitle: Leading the way in sustainable motorsport
hero.description: We're proud to be a 100% carbon neutral racing team, demonstrating that high-performance motorsport and environmental responsibility can go hand in hand.

partnership.title: Our Sustainability Partner
partnership.description: To maximise the sustainability of our team and design, we partnered with TwoEighty, a leading Sustainability Consultancy. Using the Greenhouse Gas Protocol, we calculated our complete carbon footprint and achieved carbon neutral status through their VCS Gold Standard Carbon Offsetting Programme.

breakdown.description: Team commuting to college over 6-week design period
Computer design, milling equipment and wind tunnel testing
Embodied carbon in materials used for car construction
Direct emissions from CO2 canisters for car propulsion

actions.title: Sustainable Transport
actions.description: All team members prioritised public transport for commuting to reduce our largest emission source.

actions.title: Eco-Friendly Materials
actions.description: Used sustainable filaments for 3D printing and carefully selected materials with lower embodied carbon.

actions.title: Renewable Energy Advocacy
actions.description: Advocated for our college to switch to a renewable energy tariff for all school equipment.

actions.title: Carbon Offsetting
actions.description: Partnered with TwoEighty to offset our complete carbon footprint through verified gold standard programmes.

future.title: Looking Forward
future.description: Our commitment to sustainability doesn't end here. We're continuously looking for ways to reduce our environmental impact while maintaining our competitive edge in STEM Racing.
goals: Reduce commuting emissions through better transport planning
Source materials with even lower embodied carbon
Advocate for renewable energy across all educational facilities
Share our sustainability framework with other F1 in Schools teams
